context_bundle.summary: Linkerd is a lightweight service mesh for Kubernetes providing security, reliability, and observability features with minimal resource overhead

onboarding.quick_start: linkerd install | kubectl apply -f - && kubectl annotate namespace default linkerd.io/inject=enabled && linkerd check
common_patterns: Installation: linkerd install | kubectl apply -f - for CLI-based installation
Namespace injection: kubectl annotate namespace <namespace> linkerd.io/inject=enabled
Mesh policy: kubectl apply -f -f server-policy.yaml with spec.meshTLS.mode=strict
Service profiling: linkerd viz profile -n emojivoto web --port service
Traffic split: TrafficSplit resource with spec.backends and spec.weights
Health check: linkerd check --pre to verify cluster readiness before installation
known_errors: Pods not meshed: 'kubectl get pods -n default -o yaml | grep linkerd' and verify namespace annotation
mTLS handshake failure: 'linkerd viz edges -n emojivoto' and check service profile configuration
Certificate expired: 'kubectl get secrets -n linkerd | grep identity-issuer' and restart linkerd-controller
High memory usage: 'linkerd viz tap deploy/web --to deploy/voting' to analyze traffic and adjust proxy resources
Installation fails: 'linkerd install --ignore-cluster' and fix RBAC or network policy issues
